results.title: Physical education: children aged 4 to 6 years
results.brief_description: This documentary runs through the set guidelines established by the Board of Education work schedule for infants’ first school year. Instructed in the development through free activity, independent action self control, lightens, flexibility and alertness. Based on he Board of Eduction syllabus of physical education for school, 1933.

results.title: Physical education for children
results.creator_credit: Faculty of Education and Glenn Kirchner
results.brief_description: Shows how the basic needs and interests of primary school age children are translated into a physical education program, The nature and role of intramural activities and programs for exceptional children are also covered.

results.title: Physical education at Crows Nest, Queenscliff
results.creator_credit: Owen Brothers Animated Films, Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and E.J. Perry
results.brief_description: A Victorian Education Department film detailing the physical education camp at Queenscliff for student teachers from the Ballarat, Bendigo and Melbourne Teacher’s Colleges. The student teachers learnt games, folk dancing and limited gymnastics. Commentary by Lloyd Williams.

results.title: Physical Disabilities
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
PGR examines the effects disabilities have on children and their families. One young man whose mother had taken the drug Thalidomide speaks about the effects his disability has had on his life. He has won world records for five of the six events open to armless swimming competitors. He firmly believes anyone can achieve anything they want in life, provided they want it badly enough and are willing to work and persevere in order to achieve their goals. He speaks with sensitivity and humour on the reactions of his peers, his aunt and sister, and his mother, to his disability. His happy and positive nature leaves no doubt he will continue to achieve whatever he sets his mind to.

results.title: Physical chemistry of polymers
results.creator_credit: Sol Dworkin, Bell Telephone Laboratories and John Friedman
results.brief_description: Dr. F H Winslow discusses how the physical properties of polymers are affected by molecular size and shape, the packing of molecular clusters as well as the strength of forces between molecules. Includes experiments and demonstrations one of which visually simulates the effects of thermal agitation on rubber molecules.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sol Dworkin, Bell Telephone Laboratories and John Friedman

results.title: Physical aspects of puberty
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adolescent Development”.
Describes, chiefly through animation, the physiological aspects of puberty in girls and boys. Shows that the behaviour problems which seem emotional are often based on the rate of physical growth

results.title: Physcial Education Activities for the Classroom (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A useful and informative film for classroom teachers who do not have daily access to the gymnasium or playing field. It illustrates how the classroom can be effectively used to conduct fitness activities, yoga exercises, modified games, folk and creative dance and many more exciting and challenging activities

results.title: Photosynthesis: The Biochemical process
results.brief_description: From the sun, to green plant, to chloroplasts to grana, this film focuses on the basic life-sustaining process of photosynthesis. The approach is experimental: paper, chromatography, variable lights, spectrophotometric analysis and re-creation of the experiments of Theodore Engelmann, and Melvin Calvin illustrate the physics and chemistry of the photosynthetic process.

results.title: Photosynthesis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the application of the scientific method has revealed the mechanism by which green plants transform light energy into food. Controlled experiments test the photosynthesis process and shows how each components - light, carbon dioxide, water, and chloroplasts is essential. Also introduces several advanced concepts, such as the formation of intermediate compounds and the effect of different types of light.
